document.docAuthor: Ghahari, Hassan, Moulet, Pierre & Rider, David A.
document.masterDocTitle: An annotated catalog of the Iranian Pentatomoidea (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Pentatomomorpha)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An annotated catalog of the Iranian Pentatomoidea (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Pentatomomorpha)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution in Iran .
Alborz (
Safavi 1959
;
Farahbakhsh 1961
;
Hoberlandt 1997
as
Aelia turanica
;
Samin et al .

Host plants. On barley (
Farahbakhsh 1961
;
Modarres Awal 1997 b
), wild Poaceae (
Farahbakhsh 1961
;
Modarres Awal 1996 a
,
1997 b
;
Linnavuori 2008
;
Mehneh et al . 2010
;
Nateq Golestan et al . 2011
),
Triticum
sp. ( Poaceae ) (
Farahbakhsh 1961
;
Modarres Awal 1996 a
,
1997 b
;
Khanjani 2006
),
Medicago sativa
( Fabaceae ) (
Khalilzadeh et al . 2007
),
Xanthium stramarium
( Asteraceae ),
Triticum vulgare
,
Hordeum vulgare
(both Poaceae ) (Sakenin et al . 2008 ),
Avena
sp., and
Triticum sativum
(both Poaceae ) (
Nateq Golestan et al . 2010 a
). Mainly on Poaceae (
Festuca
sp.,
Poa
sp.,
Agropyrum
sp.,
Dactylis
sp.,
Phleum
sp.), sometimes on
Carex
sp. ( Cyperaceae ),
Papaver
sp. ( Papaveraceae ) (
Derjanschi & Péricart 2005
).
Aelia acuminata
is a plague for agriculture and greatly destroys cereals (
Derjanschi & Péricart 2005
).
